means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 考特职业名称，受雇于庄园庭院者，或住所名称，来源于中世纪英语及古法语，含义是“院子”(court)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 考特绰号，来源于古法语，含义是“矮，小”(short,small)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"运动场，操场"之意。
means: playground ： 一般指附属于学校或公园内的活动场地，也可指游乐场或儿童游戏场地。
stadium ： 指周围有看台的露天大型运动场。
gymnasium ： 可简写为gym，指不受天气影响的室内体育馆、健身房或运动场馆。
court ： 通常指周围有围墙的专用球场。

sentence.Network_en: The Government is anxious to keep the whole case out of court.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府迫切希望整件事能够在庭外解决。

sentence.Network_en: A court at Tampa, Florida has convicted five officials on drugs charges.
sentence.Network_cn: 佛罗里达州坦帕市法庭判决5名官员的毒品交易罪名成立。

sentence.Network_en: The Appeal Court has quashed the convictions of all eleven people.
sentence.Network_cn: 上诉法庭已经撤销对所有11人的判决。

jx.jx_en_mean: appearing as a party or an advocate in a court of law
before a legal hearing can take place

lj.lj_ly: they are trying to settle the squabble out of court.
lj.lj_ls: 他们正试图私下解决争端。

jx.jx_en_mean: treated as impossible or not worthy of consideration

lj.lj_ly: the price would put it out of court for most private buyers.
lj.lj_ls: 这个价格会使大部分私人买主望而却步。

jx.jx_en_mean: To flatter with solicitous overtures in an attempt to obtain something or clear away antagonism.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 讨好，求爱：试图获得某物或消除敌对而用热心的表示来奉承

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French cort, from Latin cohors, cohort- 'yard or retinue'. The verb is influenced by Old Italian corteare, Old French courtoyer. Compare with cohort

encyclopedia.content: 名词 n. 1. 法庭，法院；锛埧級庭[C][U] The court found him guilty. 法庭判他有罪。 2. 锛堃淮慰サ娘級全体法官[the S][J] 3. 锛埻虻鹊娘級场地[C][U] He met her on the tennis court. 他与她在网球场上相遇。 4. 庭院，院子[C] 5. 短巷，死巷[C] 6. 朝廷；朝臣[the S][G];宫廷；王宫；锛埦鞯娘級召见[C][U] 7. 锛埾蚺缘娘級求爱；殷勤[U] 及物动词 vt. 1. 向。..献殷勤；向。..求爱锛埱蠡轱級 2. 企图获得；追求 He

entry.def: A court is a place where legal matters are decided by a judge and jury or by a magistrate.

example.ex: At this rate, we could find ourselves in the divorce courts!
example.tran: 照这样下去，我们会为离婚闹上法院！

example.ex: ...a county court judge...
example.tran: 县法院的法官

entry.tran: 全体出庭人员;(尤指)全体审判人员
entry.def: You can refer to the people in a court, especially the judge, jury, or magistrates, as a court .

example.ex: A court at Tampa, Florida has convicted five officials on drugs charges.
example.tran: 佛罗里达州坦帕市法庭判决5名官员的毒品交易罪名成立。

entry.tran: (网球、篮球、羽毛球或壁球等的)球场
entry.def: A court is an area in which you play a game such as tennis, basketball, badminton, or squash.

example.ex: The hotel has several tennis and squash courts...
example.tran: 该酒店有几个网球场和壁球场。

example.ex: She watched a few of the games while waiting to go on court.
example.tran: 她在等待上场时观看了几场比赛。

entry.def: The court of a king or queen is the place where he or she lives and carries out ceremonial or administrative duties.

example.ex: She came to visit England, where she was presented at the court of James I...
example.tran: 她来到英国访问，在詹姆士一世的王宫受到了接见。

example.ex: Their family was certainly well regarded at court.
example.tran: 他们家族在宫廷中无疑颇受敬重。

entry.tran: (用于大型宅第和公寓街区的名称中)宅第，宅邸，公寓大楼
entry.def: In Britain, Court is used in the names of large houses and blocks of flats.

example.ex: ...7 Ivebury Court, Latimer Rd, London W10 6RA.
example.tran: 伦敦西区10号第6街区拉蒂默路艾夫伯里7号公寓大楼

entry.def: If you go to court or take someone to court, you take legal action against them.

example.ex: They have received at least twenty thousand pounds each but had gone to court to demand more.
example.tran: 他们每人至少已经得到了两万英镑，但仍然向法庭提出诉讼要求获得更多。

example.ex: ...members of trade associations who want to take bad debtors to court.
example.tran: 那些想要把无力偿付的债务人告上法庭的同业公会成员

entry.def: Your day in court is your chance to give your side of an argument or other matter.

example.ex: He knew that this would be his day in court — his last chance to explain why he acted as he did...
example.tran: 他知道这是他为自己辩解的机会，是他能够解释自己为何如此行事的最后机会。

example.ex: We knew from the very beginning that it was a question of freedom of speech. All we wanted was our day in court.
example.tran: 我们从一开始就知道这是言论自由的问题。我们只要求有发表意见的机会。

entry.tran: (因为有趣或出名)引人注目，被人围观
entry.def: If someone holds court in a place, they are surrounded by a lot of people who are paying them a lot of attention because they are interesting or famous.

example.ex: ...in the days when Marlene Dietrich and Ernest Hemingway held court in the famous El Floridita club.
example.tran: 当马琳·黛德丽和欧内斯特·海明威在埃尔·佛罗利迪达俱乐部名噪一时的时候

entry.tran: (因观点或想法可笑而)对…一笑置之，对…不予考虑
entry.def: If you laugh someone out of court, you say that their opinions or ideas are so ridiculous that they are not worth considering.

example.ex: It's easy for a younger generation of critics to laugh Limon out of court...
example.tran: 年轻一代的批评家很容易对利蒙的观点一笑置之。

example.ex: Polytechnic lecturers have asked for 12.5 per cent, a claim sure to be laughed out of court.
example.tran: 理工学校的讲师要求12.5%，这一要求肯定不会予以考虑。

entry.def: If a legal matter is decided or settled out of court, it is decided without legal action being taken in a court of law.

example.ex: The Government is anxious to keep the whole case out of court.
example.tran: 政府迫切希望整件事能够在庭外解决。

example.ex: ...a payment of two million pounds in an out of court settlement.
example.tran: 经庭外和解支付200万英镑

entry.tran: (为使某人、团体或国家按自己的意愿做某事而)试图取悦，讨好
entry.def: To court a particular person, group, or country means to try to please them or improve your relations with them, often so that they will do something that you want them to do.

example.ex: Both Democratic and Republican parties are courting former supporters of Ross Perot...
example.tran: 民主党和共和党都在极力拉拢罗斯·佩罗以前的支持者。

example.ex: Stars are courted by manufacturers who value their influence on style-conscious fans.
example.tran: 生产商竞相讨好明星，他们看重的是明星对追求时尚的追星族的影响力。

entry.tran: 试图获得，追求(关注或声望)
entry.def: If you court something such as publicity or popularity, you try to attract it.

example.ex: Having spent a lifetime avidly courting publicity, Paul has suddenly become secretive.
example.tran: 保罗一生都在想方设法出风头，现在却突然行事低调了。

example.ex: ...his ability to get things done, usually by manipulating, courting favour or cleverly finding a way around opponents.
example.tran: 他的神通广大通常靠暗中操纵、讨取恩惠或巧妙地避开对手等手段

entry.tran: 招致，酿成，导致(不愉快的事)
entry.def: If you court something unpleasant such as disaster or unpopularity, you act in a way that makes it likely to happen.

example.ex: If he thinks he can remain in power by force he is courting disaster...
example.tran: 如果他认为可以通过武力继续掌权，那他就是在自寻死路。

example.ex: They argue that the commission should risk courting unpopularity and push on with its legislative programmes.
example.tran: 他们认为委员会应该甘冒不受欢迎的风险来推进其立法项目。

entry.def: If you are courting someone of the opposite sex, you spend a lot of time with them, because you are intending to get married. You can also say that a man and a woman are courting .

example.ex: I was courting Billy at 19 and married him when I was 21...
example.tran: 我19岁开始追求比利，21岁嫁给了他。

example.ex: Derek criticised every aspect of Pauline's behaviour, something he had never done when they were courting.
example.tran: 德里克对保利娜的行为举止百般挑剔，恋爱时他可从没这样做过。

means.word_mean: 1. an assembly (including one or more judges) to conduct judicial business
2. the sovereign and his advisers who are the governing power of a state
3. a specially marked area within which a game is played;

sentences.sentence: "players had to reserve a court in advance"

means.word_mean: 4. a room in which a law court sits;

sentences.sentence: "television cameras were admitted in the courtroom"

means.word_mean: 5. a yard wholly or partly surrounded by walls or buildings;

sentences.sentence: "the house was built around an inner court"

means.word_mean: 6. the residence of a sovereign or nobleman;

sentences.sentence: "the king will visit the duke's court"

means.word_mean: 7. the family and retinue of a sovereign or prince
8. a hotel for motorists; provides direct access from rooms to parking area
3. engage in social activities leading to marriage;

sentences.sentence: "We were courting for over ten years"

auth_sentence.content: He is charged but fails to appear in court.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is charged but fails to appear in court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is charged but fails to appear in court.

auth_sentence.content: None of those victims got compensated by the court.
auth_sentence.res_content: None of those victims got compensated by the court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: None of those victims got compensated by the court.

auth_sentence.content: I'll give everything I can on the court.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'll give everything I can on the court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'll give everything I can on the court.

stems_affixes.word_buile: court庭院,宫廷+eous……的→来自宫廷的礼节→有礼貌的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 法院, 庭院, 朝廷, 宫庭, 球场
stems_affixes.word_buile: court庭院,宫廷→n.法院, 庭院, 朝廷, 宫庭, 球场
court庭院,宫廷+esy→来自宫廷的礼节
court庭院,宫廷+yard院子→n.庭院, 院子
curt=court法庭+ain表名词→开庭前启幕

Sentence.sentence: The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice overtime.

This case gives the court an opportunity to rein in the growing use of patents to protect genetically engineered crops and other life forms―but the court may well use it to give this trend a powerful new endorsement.
Have we really gotten to the point that planting a seed can lead to a high-stakes Supreme Court patent lawsuit?

sentences.en: The matter is still pending in court.
sentences.cn: 这案子还在法院中悬而未决。

sentences.en: He was said to have served at court for years.
sentences.cn: 据说他曾在宫廷中任职多年。

sentences.en: Are the players on court yet?

means.word_mean: 讨好，奉承，献殷勤；向…求爱，求婚

sentences.en: He has been courting her for the last three months.
sentences.cn: 在过去的三个月中他一直在向她求爱。

jushi.english: The matter is still pending in court.
jushi.chinese: 这案子还在法院中悬而未决。

jushi.english: The defendant told the court that he had never seen the woman before.
jushi.chinese: 被告对法庭说他从未见过这位妇女。

jushi.english: Are the players on court yet?
